activities.title: Basic CSS Selectors
activities.description: Style a heading and a paragraph using basic CSS selectors.
activities.problemStatement:
Create an HTML page with the following elements and styles: 1. Title: The page title should be 'Basic CSS Selectors'. 2. Heading: Include an

element with the text 'Welcome to My Page'. Style this heading to have a navy color and use the Arial font family. 3. Paragraph: Add a

element with the text 'This is a simple paragraph of text.'. Style this paragraph to have a gray color and use the Times New Roman font family. All CSS styles should be written inside a

testCases.output:
Welcome to My Page

This is a simple paragraph of text.
required: h1 { color: navy; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; }
p { color: gray; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; }

activities.title: CSS Pseudo-Class Selectors
activities.description: Apply styles to text elements using pseudo-class selectors.
activities.problemStatement:
Create an HTML page with the following elements and styles: 1. Title: The page title should be 'CSS Pseudo-Class Selectors'. 2. Heading: Include an

element with the text 'Hover over this heading'. Style this heading to change color to green when hovered over. 3. Paragraph: Add a

element with the text 'Focus on this paragraph.'. Style this paragraph to change color to red when focused. All CSS styles should be written inside a

testCases.output:
Hover over this heading

Focus on this paragraph.

activities.title: CSS !important Keyword and Units
activities.description: Apply styles using the !important keyword and different CSS units.
activities.problemStatement:

element with some text and style it with a font size of 1.5em and margin of 20px. All CSS styles should be written inside a

Some text with different units.

activities.title: Advanced CSS Styling Challenge
activities.description: Combine multiple CSS techniques, including pseudo-classes, pseudo-elements, and the !important keyword, to create a complex styling effect.
activities.problemStatement:
Create an HTML page with the following elements and styles: 1. Title: The page title should be 'Advanced CSS Styling Challenge'. 2. Heading: Include an

element with the text 'Complex Styling'. Style this heading to include content 'Start - ' before and ' - End' after the text using pseudo-element selectors. Also, change its color to purple on hover using the !important keyword. 3. Paragraph: Add a

element with the text 'Test paragraph.' and style it with a font size of 1.2rem and margin of 15px. All CSS styles should be written inside a

testCases.output:
Complex Styling

Test paragraph.
